name: Episode Poster Generator
description: Episode Poster Generator is a Jellyfin plugin that automatically creates custom episode posters using smart frame analysis, black frame detection, and configurable text styling. Perfect for filling in missing or generic episode artwork with clean, consistent visuals.

versions.changelog:
## Improvements
- Rename FFmpegService to FrameExtractionService and relocate to Canvas services directory
- Remove dead BrightnessService dependency from frame extraction service
- Strip BrightnessService to single responsibility (brightness adjustment only), remove unused analysis methods
- Remove unused public service properties from Plugin (CanvasService, CroppingService, FrameExtractionService, TrackingDatabase, TemplateExportService, LoggerFactory)
- Clean up JS, CSS, and HTML configuration pages (remove unused code, consolidate CSS variables, use Jellyfin built-in styles)
- Update example templates to 10.11.15

## Improvements
- Use Jellyfin's built-in IMediaEncoder for frame extraction and tone mapping
- Remove custom FFmpeg tone mapping pipeline (ToneMapFilterService, HardwareFFmpegService, SoftwareFFmpegService, HardwareValidationService)
- Remove HWA (Hardware Acceleration) configuration option
- Remove file type selection, standardize output to JPEG
- Replace config action button labels with Material Icons for a more compact mobile layout
- Update example templates to include custom font properties and bump to 10.11.13

## Fixes
- HDR content appears washed out (DV with HDR10+ fallback)
- Dolby Vision content appears purple (pure DV without fallback)
- Config action buttons overflow on mobile screens

## Improvements
- Added 60-second timeout per FFmpeg frame extraction to prevent hung processes
- Added FFmpeg process kill on task cancellation and timeout to prevent zombie processes
- Added database initialization guard that blocks callers until DB is ready
- Added database wait gate to scheduled task and reset history endpoint

## Fixes
- Fixed temp file accumulation from unhandled exceptions during frame quality analysis
- Fixed database NullReferenceException when methods called before initialization completes
- Fixed custom font cache permanently caching missing files instead of retrying

## new:
  - Added per-section custom font support with checkbox toggle and file path input (TTF, OTF, TTC)
  - Refactored configuration UI into 2-tab layout (Posters | Settings) with collapsible sections
  - Added styled input modal replacing native browser prompt dialogs
  - Added series selection modal with poster thumbnails, year, and overview
  - Added unsaved changes tracking with visual indicator to both tabs
  - Added mobile responsive layout with media queries for tablet and phone screens
  - Added CSS custom properties (design tokens) for consistent theming
  - Added dynamic poster style descriptions below style dropdown
## improvements:
  - Split monolithic config page into separate HTML/JS/CSS files following Jellyfin plugin best practices
  - Reordered collapsible sections to match rendering pipeline (Poster → Canvas → Overlay → Static Graphic → Episode Information → Episode Title)
  - Added collapsible sections for Poster, Episode Information, Episode Title, Overlay, and Static Graphic settings
  - Moved plugin enable/disable and reset history to dedicated Settings tab
  - Moved Save button outside collapsible sections for consistent visibility
  - All collapsible sections default to closed on load
  - Added close button, backdrop click, and escape key to dismiss all modals
  - Added unsaved changes warning on tab switch and page navigation
  - Added green save confirmation flash with animated indicator
  - Added loading spinner in series selection modal during data fetch
  - Added scroll to top when switching poster configurations
  - Added responsive flex-wrap to configuration selector buttons
  - Added focus trapping and focus return for all modals
  - Added aria-controls, aria-describedby, aria-expanded, and aria-labelledby attributes
  - Added 200ms debounce to series search filtering
  - Added number input bounds validation on save
  - Added empty state with warning icon when no series assigned
  - Improved disabled series styling in selection modal
  - Renamed confusing Enable Poster Episode label to Extract Frame from Episode
## fixes:
  - Fixed Dolby Vision tone mapping using libplacebo for proper DV RPU dynamic metadata handling
  - Fixed DV codec mapped to HEVC for hardware decoding eligibility (DV content was forced to software-only)
  - Fixed memory leak from duplicate color control event listeners on config switch
  - Added save guard to prevent concurrent save operations on Settings tab
  - Fixed series search to use addEventListener instead of inline handler
  - Removed unused CSS rules

## Fixes
- Fixed floating point equality comparisons in TextInfo
- Improved IDisposable handling to prevent resource leaks
- Fixed potential log forging vulnerability in ConfigurationController

## Improvements
- Replaced string concatenation with LINQ in TextUtils
- Improved LINQ usage for text measurement calculations
- Added readonly modifier to configuration lookup dictionary
- Replaced loop with LINQ Where in ConfigurationController

## Features
- New Split poster style combining series poster with extracted frame
- Added BrightenHDR setting to boost brightness on HDR content

## Improvements
- Optimized frame quality analysis with downscaled processing
- Added font caching for faster poster rendering
- Reduced memory overhead by eliminating encode/decode cycles
- Centralized paint and rendering constants for consistent styling
- Added CancellationToken support for graceful task shutdown

## Fixes
- SkiaSharp API compatibility with Jellyfin's bundled version
- Fixed random seed reuse causing identical frame selections
- Added proper error logging for logo loading failures

## Improvements
- Optimized frame quality analysis with downscaled processing
- Added font caching for faster poster rendering
- Reduced memory overhead by eliminating encode/decode cycles

## Fixes
- SkiaSharp API compatibility with Jellyfin's bundled version

## Fixes
- Poster generation on 10.11's version of FFmpeg
- Alter sharpness check

## Fixes
- Poster generation on 10.11

## Fixes
- Remove temporary file creation

## Enhancements
- Cache fonts to reduce idle time on slower disks

## Technical
- Batch frame extractions to reduce calls to FFmpeg

## Documentation
- Standardized commenting accross all classes

## Fixes
- Fixed UTF-8 encoding for bullet characters and special text
- Fixed Frame poster text alignment with borders
- Fixed all VideoRangeType variants in HDR/DV tone mapping

## Enhancements
- Redesigned StandardBrush
- Added smooth bezier curves and Perlin noise for organic edges
- Added paint splatters and edge texture for realism

## Technical
- Added UTF-8 text encoding to all poster types
- Implemented Perlin noise brush stroke generation
- Added natural brush tapering with bezier curves

**Improvements**

  - Dramatically improved overall image quality with professional-grade rendering pipeline
  - Enhanced text rendering with subpixel positioning and LCD rendering for crisp, clear typography
  - Added professional soft shadow blur to all text elements for improved depth and readability
  - Implemented explicit sRGB color space handling for consistent color accuracy across all output formats
  - Increased image encoding quality to 100% for all output formats (JPEG, PNG, WEBP)
  - Enhanced FFmpeg frame extraction quality from q:v 2 to q:v 1 (absolute highest quality)
  - Added RGB24 pixel format specification for better color accuracy during frame extraction
  - Implemented gradient dithering to eliminate color banding in overlay gradients
  - Fixed Frame poster border corners to connect seamlessly without gaps
  - Improved line rendering quality with proper stroke caps across all poster styles

**Fixes**
  
  - Implemented multi-quality frame analysis system combining brightness AND sharpness detection
  - Added Laplacian variance blur detection to reject motion-blurred action shots
  - Created intelligent quality scoring algorithm that weighs both brightness and sharpness
  - Enhanced frame selection logic to find optimal frames instead of just brightest frames
  - HDR-aware quality scoring (60% brightness, 40% sharpness for HDR; 40% brightness, 60% sharpness for SDR)
  - Improved early exit logic for HDR content when quality score exceeds 0.6 threshold
  - Added comprehensive quality metrics logging (brightness, sharpness, and combined score)

**Technical**

  - Added FilterQuality.High to all bitmap drawing operations in CroppingService and poster generators
  - Implemented SubpixelText and LcdRenderText properties for all text paint objects across 6 files
  - Added MaskFilter.CreateBlur(SKBlurStyle.Normal, 1.5f) to all shadow paint objects for soft shadows
  - Configured explicit SKImageInfo with RGBA8888, Premul alpha, and sRGB color space in surface creation
  - Added SKMatrix.Identity to all gradient shader creation for proper dithering support
  - Added IsDither = true to gradient overlay paint for smooth color transitions
  - Implemented StrokeCap.Square and StrokeJoin.Miter to Frame border rendering for precise corner connections
  - Updated Standard separator lines with StrokeCap.Square for cleaner rendering
  - Enhanced Cutout border rendering with StrokeCap.Round and StrokeJoin.Round
  - Added GetFrameSharpness() method using Laplacian operator for edge detection
  - Added CalculateFrameQualityScore() method for combined brightness/sharpness scoring
  - Updated TryExtractionStrategy() to track and compare quality scores instead of brightness alone
  - Modified both SoftwareFFmpegService and HardwareFFmpegService with -q:v 1 -pix_fmt rgb24 parameters

Please find our new examples [here](https://github.com/JPKribs/jellyfin-plugin-episodepostergenerator/tree/master/Examples)!

**Features**
- Added template export/import system for sharing poster configurations
- Export poster configurations as JSON templates with metadata (author, description, & plugin version)
- Import templates from other users to quickly apply custom poster styles

**Documentation**
- Added a page for examples
- Removed old screenshots in favor of examples

**Technical**
- Added TemplateExportService for JSON serialization of poster configurations
- Created PosterTemplate model for shareable configuration format

**Technical:**
* Jellyfin 10.11 Release

**Fixes:**

  - Fixed QSV hardware acceleration failing when tone mapping is disabled
  - Fixed VAAPI, NVENC, and AMF hardware acceleration failing without tone mapping

**Technical:**

  - Changed hwdownload filter to apply unconditionally for all hardware acceleration types
  - Hardware frames now properly convert to CPU format for PNG encoding regardless of tone mapping state

**Fixes:**

  - Fixed QSV hardware acceleration failing with format conversion errors on Linux
  - Fixed QSV tone mapping producing invalid filter chain errors

**Technical:**

  - Changed QSV initialization to use VAAPI as base device matching Jellyfin behavior
  - Changed QSV to use VAAPI hwaccel method instead of direct QSV hwaccel for proper hardware frame handling
  - Changed QSV tone mapping from vpp_qsv to tonemap_vaapi filter for compatibility with VAAPI frame format

### Notice

This version is confirmed on MacOS to resolve SW Tone Mapping and HW Tone Mapping. This being said, I do not have other hardware to test this for QSV, NVENC, and VAAPI but these should mirror how Jellyfin Transcodes work so this _should_ resolve these issues as well.

**Fixes:**

  - Fixed BT.2390 and all tone mapping algorithms failing with Undefined constant error
  - Fixed VideoToolbox hardware acceleration failing to extract frames
  - Fixed QSV hardware tone mapping not working properly
  - Fixed hardware frames not converting to software for PNG encoding

**Technical:**

  - Changed software tone mapping to use tonemapx filter matching Jellyfin transcoding behavior
  - Added VideoToolbox specific tone mapping using scale_vt filter
  - Added QSV specific tone mapping using vpp_qsv filter
  - Added hwdownload filter to convert hardware frames to software for all acceleration types
  - VideoToolbox now always uses hwdownload due to videotoolbox_vld output format
  - Removed unnecessary hardware encoding arguments for PNG output

**Fixes:**

  - Rebuild 10.10.29

**Fixes:**
- Fixed BT.2390 tone mapping failing with Undefined constant error
- Fixed plugin logo not displaying in repository/installed plugins view

**Technical:**
- Corrected tone mapping filter syntax from double tonemap parameter to single in ToneMapFilterService
- Removed GetImage method from Plugin.cs to use Jellyfin default embedded resource mechanism

**Fixes:**
- Fixed duplicate default configurations being created on every plugin initialization/restart
- Fixed saved poster configurations not persisting between restarts
- Fixed UI showing only default configuration until new configuration was created
- Fixed font color and font size controls not hiding for Cutout and Numeral poster styles
- Added validation to prevent saving non-default configurations with no assigned series

**Technical:**
- Changed PluginConfiguration constructor to initialize empty PosterConfigurations list instead of creating default
- Made IsDefault an explicit boolean property instead of computed property based on SeriesIds
- Added automatic default configuration creation in PosterConfigurationService.Initialize() with persistence
- Added null safety checks with error logging in GetSettingsForSeries() and GetSettingsForEpisode()
- Updated configuration loading to properly deserialize from XML without constructor interference

**Other:**
- Improved configuration dropdown sorting to show default configuration first, then alphabetically by name
- Added validation to prevent users from naming configurations Default (reserved name)
- Updated UI logic to use IsDefault property instead of index-based detection
- Combined data-depends-on and data-hide-for-styles visibility checks to prevent conflicts

## Notice

### Major Version

The current versioning scheme is Jellyfin-Major.Jellyfin-Minor.Plugin-Version. So, 10.10.1 is Jellyfin 10.10 and version 1 for the plugin. This does a good job of tracking plugin versions and the supported Jellyfin version but it doesn't do a good job of tracking major version changes.

This is a note that this version (10.10.27) is a huge architectural change. You may need to uninstall and reinstall this plugin as the underlying settings for this plugin have changed dramatically to support **series specific posters**!

**This means, you can set a poster per series (or multiple series) or use a single default for all series.**

## Changes

**Features:**

  - Added multi-configuration support - create multiple named poster configurations with different styles
  - Added series assignment system - assign specific series to use custom poster configurations
  - Added default configuration that applies to all unassigned series
  - Added visual series tags with poster thumbnails in configuration UI
  - Added rename functionality for poster configurations
  
  **Fixes:**

  - Fixed XML serialization error preventing plugin from loading (ICollection to List conversion)
  - Fixed series names displaying as series.Name instead of actual names in UI
  - Fixed Episode Font Size and Font Color visibility in Cutout style (now properly hidden)
  
  **Technical:**

  - Refactored PosterConfiguration to use List<Guid> with proper XML serialization support
  - Added Name property to PosterConfiguration for user-friendly identification
  - Updated UI to use DOM manipulation instead of innerHTML to prevent translation system conflicts
  - Added SuppressMessage attributes for CA1002 and CA2227 code analysis warnings
  - Improved updateVisibility function to handle multiple conditional display rules
  
  **Other:**

  - Improved UI styling with Jellyfin-themed series cards including poster images and hover effects
  - Added delete protection for default configuration
  - Improved configuration dropdown to display Default for first configuration
  
  **Documentation:**

  - Updated configuration page with better field descriptions for multi-configuration workflow
  - Reorganized settings documentation into Plugin Settings and Poster Settings sections

**Features:**

  - Introduction of the new Frame poster style!

**Fixes:**

  - Attempt to rework HWA tone mapping
  - Better HWA -> SW fallback

**Technical:**

  - Encode using CPU since MJPEG is fairly limited and results in common failures

**Other:**

  - Removal or SVG and GIF types as they cause layering issues

**Documentation:**

  - Better logging to track graphic issues

**Features:**

  - Add overlay gradient

**Fixes:** 

  - Rework tone mapping
  - Better HWA -> SW fallback

**Features:**

  - Allow disabling HWA

**Fixes:** 

  - Disable HWA by default to prevent issues with VPP / VideoToolBox filters

**Other:**

  - Will need to get HWA more stable in a later release

**Features:**

  - Allow for Extract Window configuration
  - Allow for custom Graphics on top of the overlay
  - Allow clearing the database of previously processed work

**Fixes:** 

  - Fix missing Plugin Page
  - Only track changes to poster configurations not task/provider changes

**Technical:**

  - Rework to a generic 4 layer structure for extensibility
  - Use HWA filters instead of always defaulting to SW
  - VideoToolBox always defaults to SW tone mapping

**Other:**

  - Standardize all comments in code 

**Documentation:**

  - Update Read Me to better explain the processing
  - Renew screenshots on latest version
  - Add screenshot configuration steps
